alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 3:31PM CDT until June 19 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mobile County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tillmans Corner, Grand Bay, Bayou La Batre, Coden, Alabama Port, Dees, Meadow Lake, Dawes, Delchamps, Mann and Hollingers Island. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
